talk_paragraph.talk_question: <html>{ui_string:1200001}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200002}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200003}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200004}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200005}</html>
<html>{ui_string:257}</html>

$Priestess of Darkness Shea$
Because of the size of the vibration, there's a wide range of areas to look at. While we're checking the nightmare, why don't you examine the Silver Dragon's Forcefield?

$Priestess of Darkness Shea$
Of course, our Dragon must be keeping an eye on the place, but we need to determine the cause. If there's something as strange as before, we might need your power.

$Priestess of Darkness Shea$
Thank you. Take care!
<html>$Unexpected Encounter$</html>

$Priestess of Darkness Shea$
Thank you. Take care!

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Trouble? That's not it! Anyway, what the heck is going on here?!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Velskud$
(Velskud looks incredibly angry.)
Tell me! What trouble did you make this time?!

※This quest cannot be carried out in a party.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>How could I not see it? A massive new road sprang up out of nowhere!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Velskud$
You came here without even knowing what happened?
(He seems to clench his teeth as if biting his tongue.)
It was a huge vibration that shook the whole barrier, and you didn't feel it? At least you recognize that the place has changed.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Rearranged… Is that what happened in <FONT color=#086171>Saint Haven</FONT>?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Velskud$
Yeah, exactly. Space has been totally rearranged.

$Velskud$
Of course there have been changes there too. Isn't that why you came to see me?

${user_nick}$
(You tell Velskud what Priestess of Darkness Shea said and about the changes in Saint Haven.)
His Majesty and I are the only ones who recognize the situation.

$Velskud$
I'm not surprised. That's how humans are. The things that surround them have changed completely, yet they don't even see it. They carry on as calmly as fish in a fishbowl.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>But why has this happened in Saint Haven specifically?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Velskud$
Think of the underlying principles of this world, fool. Lagendia can change at any time according to the Goddess's dreams. This time the change was so enormous that the entirety of space is shaking in the aftereffects. It's because the whole dream has moved.

$Velskud$
… You still don't know what's inSaint Haven?

$Velskud$
(Glares at you coldly)

$Velskud$
… I'm talking about the Garden of Time and Space, fool!
It's a place to collect and monitor the Goddess's nightmare, so of course dreams are greatly affected.

$Velskud$
I'm sure you remember what the collapse was about.

${user_nick}$
Because Labynia haphazardly fashioned and separated the fabric of space... The Goddess's nightmares are being created randomly?

$Velskud$
You've finally found a use for that tiny head of yours.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>No way, that's why this place has changed, too?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Velskud$
……...
The Garden of Time and Space, the Labyrinth, the Storm of Time and Space… Think about it. You consider this place to be safe, but Saint Haven is on the front line of the nightmare.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>There's nothing wrong with the barrier though, right?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Velskud$
Yeah. It's the same problem. Even if the barrier blocks the nightmare's energy from flowing into the open Monolith, the change in dreams is bound to appear most intensely here.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Oh, not at all! But with that amount of vibration... The Goddess is not going to wake up, right?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Velskud$
… How dare you doubt my ability? You've become quite brave.

$Velskud$
Why, are you worried?

${user_nick}$
It's obvious! Don't we need the Cup of Healing to wake up the Goddess? Hold on… But if the Goddess wakes up, does what Feder said before come true? Our entire world will disappear! What the heck do we do?

$Velskud$
Stop making a fuss. I'm having enough trouble thinking about Labynia... Wait, what is that?

${user_nick}$
(All of a sudden, a whirlwind envelops {user_nick}'s body.)
... Huh? What? What is this?

$Velskud$
Grab my hand, you fool! What are you waiting for!

$Velskud$
Idiot! How far should I reach my hand?!

※You cannot continue while in a party.

$Geraint$
How… strange. I never would have expected a child of humanity to come here.

$Geraint$
… Come to think of it, you are a child of humanity, and yet not at the same time. Fragment of Chaos, I never expected to meet you in a place like this.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>What? How could you not know me?! We met at <FONT color=#086171>Saint Haven</FONT>.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Geraint$
I don't know that name. But you sound like we know each other.

$Geraint$
… No, I don't know you. You've obviously been pulled out of the dream, so perhaps Time and Space has been completely entangled at the moment.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Kill me?! Ah… Because of the Chaos Fragment! Allow me to explain.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Geraint$
My mission dictates that I kill you, but if I encountered a Chaos Fragment in the future and let it live... there must have been a reason.

${user_nick}$
Geraint! This jewel is not mine, it's Red Dragon Rubinart's! I carry the jewel, but I'm not a Dragon, I'm a human being. I'm always striving to protect Lagendia. That's what I'm trying to do right now! I'm telling you!

$Geraint$
What you say is difficult to understand. But……
(Geraint is staring at you.)

$Geraint$
I see the truth in your eyes. You don't seem to be simply making up a story to escape death. There is sufficient reason to hear your out in that respect.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>A dream within a dream? What does that mean?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Geraint$
This place is a dream within a dream of the Goddess. But how did you come to possess a jewel of the Red Dragon?

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>If this place is a shadow of the past, does that include you too, Geraint?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Geraint$
Sure. A dream within a dream of the Goddess, the deepest part of her dream. As Argenta said, it could be called a shadow of the past.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>It's hard for me to wrap my head around it too.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Geraint$
It sounds like from your point of view that is so. But it is a difficult question for me to readily answer from my perspective.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Huh?! That can't be. I have to get back to Eltia.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Geraint$
Most people who enter this place cannot leave on their own power. They are bound to endlessly wander here or expire along with it.

$Geraint$
(All of a sudden, a whirlwind envelops {user_nick}'s body.)
Time and space have been distorted. What a shame. I tried to extract you.

$Velskud$
Grab my hand, you fool! What are you waiting for!

$Velskud$
Idiot! How far should I reach my hand?!

※You cannot continue while in a party.

$Machina${action:Talk}
Oh it's you, {user_nick}.

${user_nick}$
Huh? This is Old Saint Haven! Oh no! Eltia?! What happened to Eltia? Eltia! Saint Haven was changing a little at first, but now it has completely transformed and Eltia is gone! Eltia! Eltia, answer me! Can you hear my voice?!

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Ack, sorry! But I can't find my little sister.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Machina${sound:npc_mac_q3868_09.ogg}
Calm down and take a deep breath. You're out of your mind.

$Machina$
You understand how you feel, but can't you see there's no one here? It's just you, me and that woman over there.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>What, the only types of people brought here?!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Machina${sound:npc_mac_q3868_05.ogg}
And it seems we all saw what was happening. That Saint Haven had changed. We're the only types of people who have been brought here.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Why do you only say things that freak me out? You're like Geraint.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Machina${sound:npc_mac_q3868_06.ogg}
Worse, we can't leave this place. Remember Lotus Marsh? There's no path leading there from here.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Yeah! He says this is the Goddess's <FONT color=#a82424>dream within a dream</FONT>. Wait, does that mean none of this is real?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Machina$
Even if you're scared, you have to look at things straight on and think about solutions. Don't you know that? Hang on… You saw Geraint?

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Since it's a <FONT color=#a82424>dream within a dream</FONT>, we might be able to escape if we really try to wake ourselves up!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Machina${sound:npc_mac_q3868_07.ogg}
The Goddess's dream within a dream… I don't know the details, but, does that mean the Goddess moved? If this movement continues, everything might change.

$Machina${sound:npc_mac_q3868_08.ogg}
(Machina sighs.)
Now I understand what Feder was saying. Maybe this is what he was afraid of.
Maybe this is what he meant when he said everything might change.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html><FONT color=#7e12d2>(This isn't really helping. You should ask Comelina.)</FONT></html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Machina${sound:npc_mac_q3868_04.ogg}
My sole focus is on going back. We have to wait until the Goddess's dream changes, right? That seems doable.

$Velskud$
Grab my hand, you fool! What are you waiting for!

$Velskud$
Idiot! How far should I reach my hand?!

※You cannot continue while in a party.

$Machina$
My sole focus is on going back. We have to wait until the Goddess's dream changes, right? That seems doable.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Comelina! Can you help me? I need to figure out how to escape a dream within a dream.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Academic Comelina${action:Talk}
Oh, it's you, {user_nick}!

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>It's freaking me out. How do we go back?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question: $Academic Comelina${sound:npc_aca_q3856_01.ogg}According to my data, this place is... Saint Haven before the Dragon Followers invasion!

$Academic Comelina${sound:npc_aca_q3856_04.ogg}
(Comelina closes her terminal and sighs.)
First you need to calm down. If we think about this together, we'll come up with an answer. Still, it is troubling that the extent of our knowledge is where we are, not how to leave or find our way back.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>That just freaks me out even more!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Academic Comelina${sound:npc_aca_q3856_02.ogg}
Indeed. All I know is that this place is a dream within a dream. I'm not one to rely solely on data, but it is unsettling to have so little information.

$Academic Comelina${sound:npc_aca_q3856_03.ogg}
History is now ours to make here... Or is it? In a world so intensely dominated by the Goddess's dream, can the history we create... carry the same weight?

${user_nick}$
What the heck are you talking about? You really don't know anything! If this is the Goddess's dream within a dream and that's why so many changes have been taking place, we have to escape and... return to the world where history is ours to make!

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Why are you looking at me like that?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Academic Comelina$
(Comelina looks at you with startled eyes.)

$Academic Comelina$
{user_nick}, you just gave me the answer.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I'll do some thinking about how to get out!</html>
<html>Maybe we can break down this door?! I'll have to think about that!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Academic Comelina$
You are correct. The first priority is determining a way out. We must return to the history of our own making!

$Academic Comelina$
(Comelina laughs.)
Yes, give it some thought. There must be a reason why we are the only ones here and there has to be a way out somehow.

${user_nick}$
(Right. We, of all people, are the only ones here. Geraint made it sound really scary... and I'm worried about Eltia, but... Somehow, I feel safer here, and I think there's a reason.)

${user_nick}$
(This time it's different from Mobius. I feel like I'm where I should be, where I should have come. And I even feel warm and cozy.)

$Velskud$
Grab my hand, you fool! What are you waiting for!

$Velskud$
Idiot! How far should I reach my hand?!

※You cannot continue while in a party.

$Academic Comelina$
Give it some thought. There must be a reason why we are the only ones here and there has to be a way out somehow.

$Velskud$
You troublemaker! What are you doing here!

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Look, we didn't come here because we wanted to!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Velskud$
Quiet! You're lucky your very existence hasn't been eradicated, coming all the way here. You fools, go back to where you came from!

$Velskud$
(Velskud glares in your direction with terrifying eyes. It would be beneficial for your health not to say anything right now.)
Do you know where you are right now? You're in a dream within a dream. I couldn't hold onto you before, so you were swept all the way here!

$Velskud$
I thought you were an okay kid, but I guess I was mistaken. It must have been hard for that woman to clean up your messes all the time...
(His mouth snaps shut and he seems to be holding back his anger.)
Quickly, grab my hand.

$Velskud$
Unless you want to spend a thousand years here, grab my hand. You'll have to keep your wits about you to avoid being swept away.

$Velskud$
You must want to stay here for a thousand years. I won't stop you.

※You cannot continue while in a party.

$Velskud$
Grab my hand, you fool! What are you waiting for!

$Velskud$
Idiot! How far should I reach my hand?!

※You cannot continue while in a party.

$Velskud$
...
<html>$Quest Complete$</html>

journal.title: Unexpected Encounter Ⅰ
journal.contents:
Go to the Silver Dragon's Forcefield.
It's true that a huge transformation has occurred, but you don't know why, or how it has affected the rest of the world. Go to the Silver Dragon's Forcefield and find out what's going on.

Silver Dragon's Forcefield-Velskud
journal.todo_msg: Go to the Silver Dragon's Forcefield.

journal.title: Unexpected Encounter Ⅱ
journal.contents:
Speak with Geraint.
After falling into the cracks created by the distortions in Time and Space, you see someone who shouldn't exist right in front of you. Talk to Geraint.

Cristal Stream - Geraint

journal.title: Unexpected Encounter Ⅲ
journal.contents:
Speak with Machina.
You were swept up by another whirlwind before you could have a proper conversation with Geraint. This time you were suddenly dropped into a new location. Will the whirlwind appear here too? Speak with the people here for now.

Old Saint Haven-Machina

journal.title: Unexpected Encounter Ⅳ
journal.contents:
Speak with Academic Comelina.
You were swept up by another whirlwind before you could have a proper conversation with Geraint. This time you were suddenly dropped into a new location. Will the whirlwind appear here too? Speak with the people here for now.

Old Saint Haven-Academic Comelina

journal.title: Unexpected Encounter Ⅴ
journal.contents:
Speak with Velskud.
As you were speaking with the others and beginning to fall into the abyss of despair, Velskud appeared before you. Is he, like Geraint, part of the Goddess's dream within a dream that appeared for but an instance? Speak with him and find out.

Old Saint Haven-Velskud

journal.title: Unexpected Encounter Ⅵ
journal.contents:
Speak with Velskud.
You escaped the Old Saint Haven, the dream within a dream. Velskud is looking your way silently. Talk to Velskud in the Silver Dragon's Forcefield.

Silver Dragon's Forcefield-Velskud
